meanings.definition: To pluck out hairs with tweezers.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tweeze her eyebrows to make them neat.
meanings.sent2: I tweeze my eyebrows every week to keep them tidy.
meanings.sent3: While watching TV, she decided to tweeze her eyebrows for fun.
meanings.sent4: The gardener tweeze the weeds from the flower bed with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tweezing hairs can be quite satisfying.

meanings.definition: To remove something with a quick, sharp movement.
meanings.sent1: He had to tweeze the splinter out of his finger carefully.
meanings.sent2: She tweeze the sticker off the wall with a swift motion.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to tweeze out the fish bones from the soup.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to tweeze the coin out of thin air.
meanings.sent5: The detective tweezed the clue from the crime scene.
